channel.title: How to wipe my Windows Vista laptop without the wiping CD?
channel.description:
Okay, well I want to pretty much wipe out my Windows Vista Laptop to like make it like brand new... Y'know... But is there anyway? Or just to do System Restore on it? Thanks!
Cheers!

item.title: How to wipe my Windows Vista laptop without the wiping CD?
item.dc:creator: @kleber883 kleber883
item.description:
@kleber883 wrote:

[quote=“ictbguud, post:1, topic:457265”]Okay, well I want to pretty much wipe out my Windows Vista Laptop to like make it like brand new… Y’know… But is there anyway? Or just to do System Restore on it? Thanks!

Cheers![/quote]

Get Gparted, burn it to a CD and boot from it. Just formats your drive. Either that or as previous people said, just use a different operating system CD.

Read full topic
item.source: How to wipe my Windows Vista laptop without the wiping CD?

item.title: How to wipe my Windows Vista laptop without the wiping CD?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

If the OS is set at windows vista by the manufacturer you should be able to restore the computer to factory settings at startup idk which function key it is but its something like f8, f11, f12 and you hold one of those keys down then it will give you this boot up screen with like the options to choose from.

Read full topic

item.title: How to wipe my Windows Vista laptop without the wiping CD?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Take out your hard drive, go somewhere high like the roof of your house and drop it onto a hard surface. Once you have Vista there is no “brand new” =.=

But seriously, could you not Google this? There are tons of guides with better answers than the ones you’ll get on here.

Read full topic
